snippet: Oklahoma’s highest criminal court on Wednesday set execution dates for three death row inmates who challenged the use of a drug that will be used in their lethal injections.
abstract: Oklahoma's Court of Criminal Appeals sets execution dates for Richard Eugene Glossip, Benjamin Robert Cole and John Marion Grant, death row inmates who challenged state's planned use of drug midazolam on grounds that it would cause undue suffering; Supreme Court approved use of drug in June ruling.
lead_paragraph: Oklahoma’s highest criminal court on Wednesday set execution dates for three death row inmates who challenged the use of a drug that will be used in their lethal injections.

headline.main: Oklahoma: Executions Are Set for 3 Who Lost Appeal Over Drug
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma: Executions Are Set for 3 Who Lost Appeal Over Drug
